content.description: Water Streak starts half way up the ramp on the southwest face. Boulder up, and clip the first bolt. The crux is somewhere between bolts 3 and 4. Buckle down for some sustained and thin face climbing that eventually leads to a ledge and roof. Pull over the roof, clip one more bolt, and top out.

Gillett gives this a 10b, it'll be the hardest 10b you'll lead that day.

Start below the crack working your way up the ramp, and place the #3 blue Camalot before you get to crack, with the yellow (#2) soon to follow. You will not need any other big gear. Work your way up crack with nice lieback and small jams. When the crack ends, place the 2 HBs (#3 & #4), and step right for the exciting finish.
content.protection: 1 blue Camalot (#3) for start, 1 yellow Camalot (#2) as a first piece in the crack, then small Aliens/nuts for the lower part of crack. At the crux near the top, I used a #3 & #4 HB. They were both bomber for the exciting finish.
content.location: On the left side of a big ramp at the end of the roofs in the middle of the face is the only crack on the face.

climbs.name: Poker Night
climbs.fa: B. Gillett, P. Bodmar, K. Younge, 2004

content.description:
Poker Night is a good route with sustained difficult and quality face climbing for the top 3 bolts. To start, climb up past 4 bolts, with crux climbing between bolts 2 and 4, generally. Take a rest on the sloping shelf below the roof, then gather up your 1-2.5" gear, and attack the crack above, which is 5.9+ for a 6' tall climber but harder for shorter climbers. Get established over the roof, and continue up the crack past easier climbing to a bolted anchor 2 meters back from the edge.

To descend, rap. Lowering, even with slings, will chew up a rope.
content.protection: 4 bolts + gear from 1-2.5" for the top crack section.
content.location:
This line is 3 meters up and left of

Water Streak

on the same ramp and is the leftmost line of bolts off of the ramp.

content.description:
After placing purple Camalot (#0.5) in a pod crack, clip 6 bolts up the face. Fun climbing leads to a ledge, proceed up 5.1 crack placing a red Camolot (#1), and belay with two remaining Camalots (#0.75 and #2).

We descended the 5.1 crack to a ledge and traversed west to huge juniper and rapped off that.
content.protection: 6 bolts, purple Camalot (#0.5) for the start. Bring a red Camalot (#1) for the crack at top & green and yellow Camalots (#0.75 and #2) for the belay.
content.location: This is on the left side of the face, past some ramps.

content.description: Career Day starts circa 35 feet right of the ramp on the southwest face. Climb up and right on easy rock to lean over to clip the first bolt. Commit to the face on the left and thin insecure moves (the crux) above the first bolt. Sustained face climbing and slabbing take you to the final bolt and the runout on hollow flakes to the top. There is decent fall potential between the last bolt and the anchors. Have fun.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
